description: Foundational patterns for Dependency Injection, Registries, and Element definition.

links.title: MDN: Custom Elements
links.context: Basis for Web Components architecture.

links.title: W3C: Context Protocol
links.context: Inspiration for dependency injection and data consumption.

description: References for Signals, Stores, and Reactivity.

links.title: TC39 Signals Proposal
links.context: Standard for fine-grained reactivity.

links.title: XState
links.context: Reference for Finite State Machines and statecharts.

description: Design systems, accessibility, and motion standards.

links.title: Open UI
links.context: Research on standardizing UI components.

links.title: WAI-ARIA Pattern
links.context: Accessibility standards for interactive components.

links.title: Framer Motion
links.context: Inspiration for declarative animation bindings.

description: Gold-standard implementations used as benchmarks for component behavior, states, and accessibility.

links.title: Material Design 3 (Google)
links.context: Benchmark for state definitions (Interaction States), elevation, and motion choreography.

links.title: Carbon Design System (IBM)
links.context: Reference for complex data density, loading patterns, and strict accessibility compliance.

links.title: Radix UI Primitives
links.context: Modern standard for 'Headless' component behavior and ARIA management.

links.title: Fluent 2 (Microsoft)
links.context: Reference for productivity-focused interfaces, density controls, and keyboard interaction.

links.title: Spectrum (Adobe)
links.context: Best-in-class example of adaptive scaling (Touch/Mouse) and theming systems.

links.title: Human Interface Guidelines (Apple)
links.context: Defines the 'Native Feel' baseline for modal, navigation, and feedback patterns.

links.title: GOV.UK Design System
links.context: The gold standard for form validation behaviors, error messaging, and copywriting.

description: Compilers, bundlers, and static site generation.

links.title: 11ty
links.context: Our Static Site Generator of choice.

description: Resources for comparing frameworks, understanding patterns, and exploring real-world implementations. Research for a potential 'Web Recipes' project.

links.title: Patterns.dev
links.context: Excellent resource on design, rendering, and performance patterns. React-focused but high quality explanations with code examples.

links.title: Component Party
links.context: Side-by-side syntax comparison across 15+ frameworks. Covers reactivity, state, templating, lifecycle. Simple but useful for quick comparisons.

links.title: RealWorld (Conduit)
links.context: Medium.com clone with 100+ implementations. Real app with auth, CRUD, routing. Good but requires commitment to compare repos individually.

links.title: js-framework-benchmark
links.context: Micro-benchmarks for 100+ frameworks. Useful for raw performance metrics but synthetic (forbids virtualization, lazy loading).

links.title: web.dev/patterns
links.context: Google's pattern library: Animation, Clipboard, Components, Layout. Vanilla JS/CSS focused, accessibility-conscious, but not framework-comparative.

links.title: TodoMVC
links.context: The original framework comparison. Too simple for real architectural decisions but useful for basic syntax overview.

description: Gap analysis for a potential new project: complex, isolated use cases showing multiple strategies per framework with pros/cons. Unlike existing resources, would focus on architectural trade-offs for real-world patterns.

links.title: Gap: Complex Use Cases
links.context: TodoMVC is too simple. RealWorld is one app. Need isolated, complex patterns (infinite scroll, optimistic updates, real-time sync, etc.).

links.title: Gap: Multiple Strategies
links.context: Existing resources show one implementation per framework. Real projects need to understand trade-offs between different approaches.

links.title: Gap: Architectural Decisions
links.context: Component Party shows syntax, not architecture. Patterns.dev explains patterns but is React-only. Need cross-framework architectural comparison.
